730898f.title: Bridges - Marine Parkway Bridge - [Rockaway Inlet between Brooklyn and Rockaway.]

730897f.title: Bridges - Marine Parkway Bridge - [Rockaway Inlet between Brooklyn and Rockaway.]

730899f-b.title: Bridges - Marine Parkway Bridge - [Rockaways - Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn.]
730899f-b.text:
Marine Parkway Bridge: A set of three views in different directions
of the newly constructed causeway that links the Rockways with Flatbush
Avenue, Brooklyn. No's. 1 and 2 are from a vantage point on Barren
Island, Rockway, while No. 3 is towards the latter. Note the former
Slips on both sides of this Jamaica BayInlet, from which Municipal
Ferries steamed, carrying traffic that now uses the Bridge.
July 24, i937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
Not a Dry Mount Item.

(1) anc (2)
Marine Parkway Bridges Viewing north across Rockaway
Inlet from Jacob Riis Park, Rockaway, 92ueens, toward Brooklyn.
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS  July 18, 1937
Views 1,2
(3)
The bridge under construction.
L. Sperr  i6 REPRDDUCTIONS  August 30, 1936

730900f-a.text:
(1 a 2)
Marine Parkway Bridge, from the foot of Flatbush Ave. to the Rockaways,

730901f-b.title: Bridges - Marine Parkway Bridge - [Rockaways - Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn.]
730901f-b.text:
Marine Parkway Bridge: A set of three views, showing the
bridge connecting the Rockaways with Brooklyn via Flatbush Ave.
Also seen are the former ferry slips, now obsolete, which formerly
carried the traffic that now uses the bridge.
July 24, 1937
Views 1,2 and 3
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED
